statement:
Suppose $\Omega \subset {\mathbb{R}}^2$ is a with a smooth boundary
$\partial \Omega$ and suppose that ${\mathbb{D}}$ is the unit disc. Then
given any homeomorphism
$\mu : \partial {\mathbb{D}} \rightarrow \partial \Omega$, there exists
a unique harmonic function $u : {\mathbb{D}} \rightarrow \Omega$ such
that $u = \mu$ on $\partial {\mathbb{D}}$ and $u$ is a diffeomorphism.

[9]{} R. Schoen, S. T. Yau. **. International Press, Inc., Boston,
Massachusetts, 1997
